rev.comment: an External hard disk drive can also be a Live USB system

[[Image:Live USB ubuntu.png|thumb|280px|right|a live USB of [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]], running [[Firefox]], [[OpenOffice.org]] and [[Nautilus (file manager)|nautilus]]]]
[[Image:Live USB ubuntu.png|thumb|280px|right|a live USB of [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]], running [[Firefox]], [[OpenOffice.org]] and [[Nautilus (file manager)|nautilus]]]]
[[Image:Sony Micro Vault Tiny 4 GB.jpg|thumb|70px|right|A [[USB Flash Drive]]]]
[[Image:Sony Micro Vault Tiny 4 GB.jpg|thumb|70px|right|A [[USB Flash Drive]]]]
â
A '''live USB''' or '''USB live distro''' is a [[USB flash drive]] containing a full [[operating system]] which can be [[booting|booted]]. Live USBs are closely related to [[live CD]]s, and are sometimes used interchangeably. Like live CDs, live USBs can be used in embedded systems [[system administration]], [[data recovery]], or the testing of operating system distributions without committing to a permanent installation on the local [[hard disk drive]]. Many operating systems including Microsoft [[Windows XP Embedded]] and many of the smaller [[Linux distribution]]s can also be used from a USB flash drive.
+
A '''live USB''' or '''USB live distro''' is a [[USB flash drive]] or an [[external hard disk drive]] containing a full [[operating system]] which can be [[booting|booted]]. Live USBs are closely related to [[live CD]]s, and are sometimes used interchangeably. Like live CDs, live USBs can be used in embedded systems [[system administration]], [[data recovery]], or the testing of operating system distributions without committing to a permanent installation on the local [[hard disk drive]]. Many operating systems including Microsoft [[Windows XP Embedded]] and many of the smaller [[Linux distribution]]s can also be used from a USB flash drive.
==Benefits and limitations==
==Benefits and limitations==
